description: This file implements the control functions for a TLS (Transport Layer Security) client object, specifically focusing on starting the TLS handshake process and related session management.

classes.name: PTLS_HSO_CLIENT_OBJECT
classes.description: The main object representing the TLS Hso Client, containing session state, control functions, and references to functional interfaces.

classes.name: PTLS_SESSION_STATE
classes.description: Structure holding the current session's state, including session ID, cipher suite, and other session-specific parameters.

classes.name: PTLS_SECURITY_PARAMS
classes.description: Structure holding security-related parameters for the TLS session, such as connection end type.

classes.name: PTLS_CBC_INTERFACE
classes.description: Interface for controlling CBC-related TLS functions, including setting session ID, cipher suite, compression methods, etc.

classes.name: PTLS_MEC_INTERFACE
classes.description: Interface for higher-level TLS management functions, including retrieving HSM interface.

classes.name: PTLS_HSM_INTERFACE
classes.description: Interface for handling HSM-related functions such as session selection.

classes.name: PTLS_CONNECTION_PARAMS
classes.description: Structure holding connection parameters like HostID, PeerID, and quick handshake flag.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS TlsHsoClientStart(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Initiates the TLS handshake process, potentially reusing previous sessions, and manages the state transitions and message sending timing.
